meanings.sent1: The chared toast was too dark to eat.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter found the chared remains of the house.
meanings.sent3: The chared marshmallows were a hit at the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The chared wood resembled charcoal after the fire.
meanings.sent5: The chared edges of the paper showed it had been too close to the flame.

meanings.definition: To cook food quickly over high heat
meanings.sent1: She chared the steak on the grill for a delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: The chef chared the vegetables to perfection in the wok.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally chared the hot dogs, but they were still edible.
meanings.sent4: The flames leaped up as she chared the meat over the fire.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the chared meat filled the kitchen with a mouth-watering smell.

meanings.definition: To become blackened or discolored by heat
meanings.sent1: The bread started to chared around the edges in the oven.
meanings.sent2: The pot chared from being left on the stove for too long.
meanings.sent3: The marshmallows chared quickly over the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The once white shirt chared in the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The paper chared at the edges when it accidentally touched the candle flame.
